item.title: 日本央行本月加息预期大跌，打压日元走低
item.description: 市场对日本央行本月加息的预期有所下降，因为当地媒体的一篇报道对日本央行加息表示怀疑，这对日元造成了压力。【原文：Market expectations of a Bank of Japan interest rate hike this month sank after a local media report cast doubt on an increase, weighing on the yen.】

item.title: 澳大利亚家庭因体育赛事和音乐会而支出激增
item.description: 由于消费者购买了国际音乐会和体育赛事的门票，澳大利亚 10 月份的家庭支出超过了预期，这表明今年最后一个季度的经济开始走强。【原文：Australia’s household spending exceeded estimates in October, suggesting the final quarter of the year began on a stronger note as consumers bought tickets to international music concerts and sporting events.】

item.title: 鲍威尔表示对降息持谨慎态度后黄金保持稳定
item.description: 在可能影响美联储下一次利率决定的数据公布之前，市场消化了美联储主席的讲话，黄金在小幅上涨后持稳。【原文：Gold was steady after a modest gain as the market digested remarks from the head of the Federal Reserve before data that may influence the central bank’s next interest-rate decision.】

item.title: 墨西哥国会审议应用程序工人的最低工资和福利问题
item.description: 墨西哥立法者将讨论一项提案，为优步（Uber Technologies Inc.）、滴滴全球（Didi Global Inc）和拉皮（Rappi Inc）等公司的司机和快递员提供最低工资和其他福利。【原文：Mexican lawmakers are set to discuss a proposal that gives a minimum wage and other benefits to drivers and couriers working for companies such as Uber Technologies Inc., Didi Global Inc and Rappi Inc.】

item.title: 英国 11 月份销售的新车中有四分之一是电动汽车
item.description: 一家交通研究机构称，上个月在英国注册的新车中，每四辆就有一辆是全电动汽车，并将这一新数据视为英国电动汽车销售政策正在发挥作用的证据。【原文：One in four new cars registered in the UK last month were fully electric, a transportation research group said, touting the new figures as evidence that the country’s EV sales mandate is working.】

item.title: 荷兰国际集团（ING）称，欧洲央行的收益率曲线控制有可能抑制经济增长
item.description: 荷兰国际集团（ING）称，如果政府借贷成本飙升削弱了降息的影响，欧洲央行可能会采取收益率曲线控制措施。【原文：The European Central Bank may resort to yield-curve control if a surge in government borrowing costs damps the impact of interest-rate cuts, according to ING.】

item.title: 对冲基金让微策略成为华尔街最热门交易
item.description: 迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）从哪里弄到这么多钱来满足他对比特币的狂热追求？一部分是被微策略公司（MicroStrategy Inc.另一大部分则来自对冲基金，他们对比特币股票的走势并不关心。【原文：Where does Michael Saylor get all the money he spends to sate his rampant appetite for Bitcoin? Part of it is retail investors transfixed by MicroStrategy Inc.’s more than 500% rally this year. Another big chunk is coming from hedge funds who care far less where the stock trades.】

item.title: 美联储主席戴利表示没有降息的紧迫感
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）表示，没有降息的紧迫感，强调官员们可以 "仔细调整 "政策。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly said there’s no sense of urgency to lower interest rates, emphasizing officials can “carefully calibrate” policy.】

item.title: 韩国重申行动誓言，敦促市场保持冷静
item.description: 在震惊全国的戒严风波发生一天后，韩国决策者敦促金融市场保持冷静，并再次承诺将采取一切可能的措施来抑制唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）下月重新掌权前仍可能加剧的波动。【原文：South Korean policymakers urged calm in financial markets a day after a martial-law row that stunned the nation, renewing their pledge to take all possible steps to rein in volatility that could still increase ahead of Donald Trump’s return to power next month.】

item.title: 政治动荡为陷入困境的韩国市场增添阴霾
item.description: 韩国的政治动荡给该国陷入困境的资产又增添了一层不确定性，投资者正准备迎接三重打击。【原文：Investors are bracing for a triple whammy as South Korea’s political turmoil adds another layer of uncertainty for the country’s struggling assets.】

item.title: 石油保持跌势，交易商将焦点转向欧佩克+供应会议
item.description: 石油在下跌后企稳，交易商期待周四举行的欧佩克+会议，预计该卡特尔将再次推迟恢复已经供应充足的市场中被关闭的产能。【原文：Oil steadied after a decline, with traders looking ahead to an OPEC+ meeting on Thursday that’s expected to see the cartel again defer a move revive shuttered capacity in an already well-supplied market.】

item.title: Synapse 倒闭后，FDIC 寻求直接监控金融科技公司
item.description: 据熟悉联邦存款保险公司监管业务的人士透露，该公司已开始直接监控全美与银行合作的金融科技公司。【原文：The Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. has started to directly monitor financial-technology companies that partner with banks across the US, according to people familiar with the regulator’s supervisory operations.】

item.title: 前贸易部长称，特朗普喜欢关税，但加拿大可以在石油问题上反击
item.description: 这位曾在唐纳德-特朗普第一任期内领导加拿大贸易谈判团队的人士说，美国当选总统 "现在更喜欢关税了"，在第二任期内使用关税的限制会减少。【原文：The man who led Canada’s trade negotiating team during Donald Trump’s first term said the US President-elect “likes tariffs even more now” and will be less constrained about about using them in his second.】

item.title: 全球股市触顶，鲍威尔看好经济：市场综述
item.description: 由于杰罗姆-鲍威尔的看涨言论支撑了风险资产，全球股市在周三创下新高后将继续攀升。由于法国政府在不信任投票后倒台，汇市交易员仍处于紧张状态。【原文：Global equities were set to climb higher after setting a fresh peak on Wednesday as bullish comments from Jerome Powell supported risk assets. Currency traders remained on edge as the French government fell after a no-confidence vote.】

item.title: Corteva 首席执行官希望在巴西复制美国大豆的成功经验
item.description: 在凭借大豆除草剂技术征服美国市场之后，Corteva 公司又将目光投向了这个油菜籽产量超过其他任何地方的国家。【原文：After conquering the US market with its weedkiller technology for soybeans, Corteva Inc. has its sights on the nation that produces more of the oilseed than anywhere else.】

item.title: Spotify 计划在就职日开设工作室和早午餐，以吸引播客
item.description:
这家瑞典流媒体巨头正在全力投入 "播客选举"

。【原文：

The Swedish streaming giant is leaning fully into the “podcast election”

】

item.title: 美国称零散蜘蛛少年黑客攻击电信运营商向受害者发送垃圾邮件
item.description: 美国检察官公布了对一名少年黑客的指控，这名少年黑客曾与一个臭名昭著的网络犯罪团伙合作入侵电信公司，让人们对关键基础设施供应商的脆弱性有了新的认识。【原文：US prosecutors unsealed charges against an alleged teenage hacker who worked with a notorious cybercrime crew to break into telecommunications firms, providing new insights into the vulnerabilities of critical infrastructure providers.】

item.title: 实现流媒体盈利后，迪士尼将股息提高 33
item.description: 华特迪士尼公司将年度股息提高了 33%，达到每股 1 美元，这是两年前实施的扭亏为盈计划取得成效的又一迹象。【原文：Walt Disney Co. raised its annual dividend by 33% to $1 a share, another sign that a turnaround plan put in place two years ago is paying off.】

item.title: 维韦克-拉马斯瓦米希望将国防开支转向新技术
item.description: 前总统候选人维韦克-拉马斯瓦米（Vivek Ramaswamy）认为，特朗普第二任政府应将五角大楼的投资转向无人机和高超音速导弹等新兴技术。【原文：The second Trump administration should shift investments at the Pentagon in favor of emerging technologies such as drones and hypersonic missiles, according to Vivek Ramaswamy, the former presidential candidate who has been tapped along with Elon Musk to cut wasteful spending.】

item.title: TikTok 商店黑色星期五销售额增长三倍，突破 1 亿美元
item.description:
禁令临近，公司大举押注美国电子商务部门

。【原文：

Company is betting big on its US e-commerce arm as ban looms

】

item.title: 英特尔坚持 CEO 离职后的预测，誓言更加节俭
item.description: 英特尔公司（Intel Corp. ）首席执行官帕特-盖尔辛格（Pat Gelsinger）刚刚突然离职，该公司在周三的发布会上坚持目前的财务预测，同时还表示将严格控制资本支出。【原文：Intel Corp., fresh off the abrupt departure of Chief Executive Officer Pat Gelsinger, stuck with its current financial forecast during a presentation Wednesday while also saying it would keep a tight rein on capital spending.】

item.title: 白宫称中国黑客入侵八家美国电信运营商
item.description: 拜登政府官员周三表示，中国黑客入侵了八家美国电信公司，这是收集美国知名公民情报的广泛间谍活动的一部分。【原文：Chinese hackers compromised eight American telecommunications companies as part of a wide-ranging espionage effort to gather intelligence about prominent US citizens, Biden administration officials said Wednesday.】

item.title: 迈阿密海滩枫丹白露酒店将在债券市场借款 9.75 亿美元
item.description: 迈阿密海滩枫丹白露酒店是一家成立于 20 世纪 50 年代的豪华酒店，该酒店计划出售 9.75 亿美元的商业抵押担保证券，为其债务进行再融资。【原文：Fontainebleau Miami Beach, a luxury hotel founded in the 1950s, plans to sell a $975 million commercial mortgage-backed security to refinance its debt.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司股价因董事长将离职的报道而下跌
item.description: 三位熟悉内情的人士透露，巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）董事长彼得罗-门德斯（Pietro Mendes）将离开这家石油生产商，转而担任巴西石油监管机构的董事，这让投资者对该公司的分红政策感到不安。【原文：Petrobras Chairman Pietro Mendes will leave the oil producer to become a director at Brazil’s oil regulator, three people familiar with the matter said, leaving investors uneasy about the company’s dividend policy.】

item.title: 贝莱德的博文称全球债券比美国国债更受青睐
item.description: 贝莱德投资研究所（BlackRock Investment Institute）所长让-博文（Jean Boivin）认为，明年通胀将迫使美联储采取观望态度，投资者应青睐全球债券而非期限较长的美国国债。【原文：Investors should favor global bonds over longer-dated US Treasuries, with sticky inflation forcing the Federal Reserve to the sidelines next year, according to Jean Boivin, head of BlackRock Investment Institute.】

item.title: 法国政府垮台后，马克龙的宏伟计划毁于一旦
item.description:
这个国家从未如此接近勒庞政府，而这正是马克龙总统不惜一切代价要避免的。【原文：

The country has never been closer to a Le Pen administration — the one thing President Macron has sought to avoid at all costs.

】

item.title: 美国商品期货交易委员会（CFTC）打击加密货币的救济金达到创纪录的 171 亿美元
item.description: 美国商品期货交易委员会的罚款和投资者救济达到创纪录的 171 亿美元，这主要归功于该机构对已停业的加密货币交易所 FTX 的打击。【原文：The US Commodity Futures Trading Commission’s fines and investor relief hit a record $17.1 billion, largely due to the agency’s crackdown on defunct crypto exchange FTX.】

item.title: 巴尼耶政府倒台后法国债券期货保持涨势
item.description: 在极右翼领导人玛丽娜-勒庞加入左翼联盟推翻政府后，法国国债期货守住了早些时候的涨幅，这为进一步的政治争斗创造了条件，数月来的政治争斗已对法国资产造成了压力。【原文：French bond futures held onto earlier gains after far-right leader Marine Le Pen joined a left-wing coalition to topple the government, setting the stage for further political wrangling that has weighed on the nation’s assets for months.】

item.title: 美国最小企业的工资增长速度为两年来最快
item.description: 美国 ADP 研究所的数据显示，11 月份美国小型企业的工资增长速度自去年年初以来首次加快。【原文：Wage growth among the smallest US businesses accelerated in November for the first time since early last year, according to data from the ADP Research Institute.】

item.title: Amundi 有意收购安联全球投资公司
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Amundi SA 有意收购安联集团（Allianz SE）旗下资产管理公司安联全球投资公司（Allianz Global Investors）的控制权，因为这家法国公司正在行业整合中寻找交易机会。【原文：Amundi SA is interested in acquiring control of Allianz SE’s asset manager Allianz Global Investors as the French company scouts for deals amid industry consolidation, people familiar with the matter said.】
